narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This course has less required work than others, but that is in part because the instructor makes himself available to help guide work in relation to individual interest. Dr. Draghi helps guide students through Yale's extensive resources and is exceptionally available outside of course hours to help identify and explore additional resources from the Beinecke, BAC, or YUAG's vast collections or to recommend further related readings.

I loved the field trips. As someone completely unfamiliar with Connecticut and New Haven, the field trips were very beneficial because they showed me a) which cultural centers are available in the local area (museums and art galleries), b) treasures that I had no idea existed at Yale or anywhere so close to me, and c) objects that perfectly tie into the archetypal themes of the course.
I feel that the coursework was appropriate. The course was structured so that you could learn at a pace conducive to your learning habits.
The fieldtrips, the open discussions, and the final project.
Courses held at the Beinecke, Yale Art Gallery, British Art CenterExploration of Yale's campusUnderstanding archetypes and their relation to F&ES, Yale, and Environmental issues and studies
The field trips and the class discussions, especially those about the historical role of nature and the environment.
Looking at all the archtypes in the environment, and seeing them around campus, i.e. at the Beinecke, etc.
Trips to the Beinecke and getting to see rare manuscripts.
Field Trips

Prof. Draghi explains subject matter with magnificent clarity. His classes are fascinating with in-depth knowledge on the subject of archetypes and the environment.Sometimes I felt we were being taught by an alchemist, who gives enough information to incite curiosity and it is up to the student to search for more knowledge on the subject of interest.I also enjoyed the books of Joseph Campbell as well as the field trips to Yale museums and libraries.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Keep the digressions down a little bit more.
Not enough time for all the field visits that could be done!
I don't think that anything needs to be improved.
N/A
The actual subject matter, concepts of the course.
1. Incorporating assigned class readings into each weekly class, depending on the subject to be explored.2. Adhering to a class syllabus or agenda that provides a course structure.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Contacted the instructor--very available and very helpful. Moreso than other professors and I really appreciated that.
Both the instructor and TA made themselves consistently available for discussion and further exploration of any topic of interest. I always found their insights helpful.
They were willing to drop everything to meet with students at a moment's notice, and encouraged this. Kudos to both Dr. Draghi and Meredith.
Both the instructor and the T.A. were very available for assistance when I needed it.
Fully Available.
Both the instructor as well as the TA were available and dependable for assistance, especially in the design of the final class project.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course helps me to understand themes running through the issues we are learning to face tactically and theoretically in other courses. It places contemporary environmental policy in an historical and cultural context. It has also helped me to think about how I may present my very specific academic research to a broader audience.

I wanted to know more about the historical significance of environmental archetypes and themes and how they play into different parts of the current environmental/green building/green design movements.
My academic background is seeped in the arts. This course was good because it gave me examples of how the environment is viewed in different religions and cultures from all over the world.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To explore Yale's resources
I met Dr. Draghi at Mods, and I thought that his course would add variety to my tree/strict forestry classes.
I wanted a better understanding of environmental archetypes
I had always been interested in the subject of archetypes and found interesting the union of this subject with the environment.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: yes.
Yes
Yes.
It exceeded my expectations.
Yes!

I truly enjoyed the presentations given by Prof. Draghi in class. However, I believe I would have been better equiped or prepared to engage in a class discussions if we would have assigned readings related to the subjects to be discussed on a weekly basis.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Yes
Everything.
Yes
I got what I expected and feel that I want to learn more about this subject in the future.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This course is unlike any other you will ever take at F&ES. Be prepared to explore the humanities and their relation to environmental sciences. Think about why you chose to come to Yale and how you can utilize the university's resources in your chosen field of study. ENJOY!
Begin working on your final project early so that you don't have to juggle a final project with papers and exam studying.
Bring a good attitude, and an open mind, and you will learn something.
Don't expect a lot of content, just come ready to learn whatever is on the table for that day. Trips to the Beinecke are interesting, otherwise content is mostly student-generated.

Prof. Draghi explains subject matter with magnificent clarity. His classes are fascinating with in-depth knowledge on the subject of archetypes and the environment.I recommend that students request assigned readings related to the subjects to be discussed weekly in order to be better equiped or prepared to engage in class discussions and gain more knowledge throughout the course.
